Double-tap an image to focus on it. Use the seek bar to manually control the shown frame. You can pinch-zoom the image. To get back, double-tap again or press the Android Back-button. 
 
Place the app's widget on your home screen to have quick access to the current radar image. 
 
Tap the widget image to start the app. 
 
The app uses OCR to read the image's timestamp, translates it to your timezone, and shows it above the image. Sometimes the websites stop updating their images, in that case you'll see the image's age growing. Once the age reaches one hour, the text turns red to alert you that the image is no longer up-to-date. 
 
The app is very conservative with internet traffic usage and never has to fetch the same image twice, but you always get the latest images thanks to the If-Modified-Since HTTP headers. Owing to this, sometimes an image refresh takes just fraction of a second, but you can rest assured that we contacted the server and it replied that you already have the latest image. If we can't contact a server, the title above its image will say “Offline”.
